title: Ridiculously high ping, Weird trace route! *urgent*
body:
Hello! Since a couple of months ago, I have been experiencing a very consistently high ping. After the server move, I was able to maintain ~23ms. Unfortunately, for what ever reason, it was jumped to being 60-100ms consistently. I ran a trace-route to determine the problem node, and have found out that my connection is being routed to Riot Games LA location. This was a concern to me because I live in northern Ohio, about 3hrs away from Chicago which I where I thought the servers were moved to. I am unsure if this is a problem with my ISP (Buckeye Cable System) or on your guys end. I don't believe that it is a problem on my side, because everyone I have conversed with locally has told me the same thing.  I will go ahead and paste in my trace-route below. Thanks in advance! 

traceroute to 104.160.131.1 (104.160.131.1), 30 hops max, 38 byte packets
1 10.24.0.1 (10.24.0.1) 10.000 ms 20.000 ms 10.000 ms
2 72.240.7.61 (72.240.7.61) 10.000 ms 20.000 ms 10.000 ms
3 72.240.111.33 (72.240.111.33) 20.000 ms 72.240.111.29 (72.240.111.29) 20.000 ms 72.240.111.33 (72.240.111.33) 20.000 ms
4 72.240.111.49 (72.240.111.49) 20.000 ms 10.000 ms 40.000 ms
5 xe-10-3-2.bar2.Detroit1.Level3.net (4.53.74.101) 30.000 ms 50.000 ms 40.000 ms
6 *Terminated
=============Complete==============

replies.body: I'm not really sure where this traceroute is going.  I can get a better image of your routing through [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/).  Download that and run a traceroute directly to the NA game server:  104.160.131.1.  This can certanly help determine any routing issues, but also keep in mind that there may be more local problems as well.  I would recommend using the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide before expanding from there.  I hope that helps!
